name.description: Workflow name that appears in the GitHub Actions interface. If not specified, defaults to the filename without extension.

description.description: Optional workflow description that is rendered as a comment in the generated GitHub Actions YAML file (.lock.yml)

on.description: Workflow triggers that define when the agentic workflow should run. Supports standard GitHub Actions trigger events plus special command triggers for /commands (required)

oneOf.description: Simple trigger event name (e.g., 'push', 'issues', 'pull_request', 'schedule')
Complex trigger configuration with event-specific filters and options

command.description: Special command trigger for /command workflows (e.g., '/my-bot' in issue comments). Creates conditions to match slash commands automatically.

oneOf.description: Null command configuration - defaults to using the workflow filename (without .md extension) as the command name
Command configuration object with custom command name

name.description: Custom command name for slash commands (e.g., 'helper-bot' for '/helper-bot' triggers). Defaults to workflow filename without .md extension if not specified.

push.description: Push event trigger that runs the workflow when code is pushed to the repository

tags.description: List of git tag names or patterns to include for push events (supports wildcards)

tags-ignore.description: List of git tag names or patterns to exclude from push events (supports wildcards)

pull_request.description: Pull request event trigger that runs the workflow when pull requests are created, updated, or closed

types.description: List of pull request event types to trigger on (e.g., 'opened', 'edited', 'closed', 'synchronize')

draft.description: Filter by draft pull request state. Set to false to exclude draft PRs, true to include only drafts, or omit to include both

oneOf.description: Single fork pattern (e.g., '*' for all forks, 'org/*' for org glob, 'org/repo' for exact match)
List of allowed fork repositories with glob support (e.g., 'org/repo', 'org/*', '*' for all forks)

items.description: Repository pattern with optional glob support

issues.description: Issues event trigger that runs the workflow when repository issues are created, updated, or managed

oneOf.description: Simple workflow dispatch trigger

workflows.description: List of workflows to trigger on

pull_request_review_comment.description: Pull request review comment event trigger

types.description: Types of pull request review comment events

stop-after.description: Time when workflow should stop running. Supports multiple formats: absolute dates (YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS, June 1 2025, 1st June 2025, 06/01/2025, etc.) or relative time deltas (+25h, +3d, +1d12h30m)

reaction.description: AI reaction to add/remove on triggering item (one of: +1, -1, laugh, confused, heart, hooray, rocket, eyes). Defaults to 'eyes' if not specified.

permissions.description: GitHub token permissions for the workflow. Controls what the GITHUB_TOKEN can access during execution. Use the principle of least privilege - only grant the minimum permissions needed.

oneOf.description: Simple permissions string: 'read-all' (all read permissions), 'write-all' (all write permissions), 'read' or 'write' (basic level)
Detailed permissions object with granular control over specific GitHub API scopes

actions.description: Permission for GitHub Actions workflows and runs (read: view workflows, write: manage workflows, none: no access)

attestations.description: Permission for artifact attestations (read: view attestations, write: create attestations, none: no access)

checks.description: Permission for repository checks and status checks (read: view checks, write: create/update checks, none: no access)

contents.description: Permission for repository contents (read: view files, write: modify files/branches, none: no access)

deployments.description: Permission for repository deployments (read: view deployments, write: create/update deployments, none: no access)

discussions.description: Permission for repository discussions (read: view discussions, write: create/update discussions, none: no access)

issues.description: Permission for repository issues (read: view issues, write: create/update/close issues, none: no access)

models.description: Permission for GitHub Copilot models (read: access AI models for agentic workflows, none: no access)

run-name.description: Custom name for workflow runs that appears in the GitHub Actions interface (supports GitHub expressions like ${{ github.event.issue.title }})

defaults.description: Default settings that will apply to all jobs in the workflow

working-directory.description: Default working directory for run steps

jobs.description: Groups together all the jobs that run in the workflow

oneOf.description: Runner type as string
Runner type as array
Runner type as object

Multiple job dependencies

container.description: Container to run the job in

group.description: Runner group name for self-hosted runners

labels.description: List of runner labels for self-hosted runners

timeout_minutes.description: Workflow timeout in minutes. Defaults to 15 minutes for agentic workflows. Has sensible defaults and can typically be omitted.

oneOf.description: Simple concurrency group name to prevent multiple runs. Agentic workflows automatically generate enhanced concurrency policies.
Concurrency configuration object with group isolation and cancellation control

group.description: Concurrency group name. Workflows in the same group cannot run simultaneously.

cancel-in-progress.description: Whether to cancel in-progress workflows in the same concurrency group when a new one starts

network.description: Network access control for AI engines using ecosystem identifiers and domain allowlists. Controls web fetch and search capabilities.

oneOf.description: Use default network permissions (basic infrastructure: certificates, JSON schema, Ubuntu, etc.)
Custom network access configuration with ecosystem identifiers and specific domains

allowed.description: List of allowed domains or ecosystem identifiers (e.g., 'defaults', 'python', 'node', '*.example.com')

items.description: Domain name or ecosystem identifier (supports wildcards like '*.example.com' and ecosystem names like 'python', 'node')

post-steps.description: Custom workflow steps to run after AI execution

engine.description: AI engine configuration that specifies which AI processor interprets and executes the markdown content of the workflow. Defaults to 'claude'.

oneOf.description: Simple engine name: 'claude' (default, Claude Code), 'copilot' (GitHub Copilot CLI), 'codex' (OpenAI Codex CLI), or 'custom' (user-defined steps)
Extended engine configuration object with advanced options for model selection, turn limiting, environment variables, and custom steps

id.description: AI engine identifier: 'claude' (Claude Code), 'codex' (OpenAI Codex CLI), 'copilot' (GitHub Copilot CLI), or 'custom' (user-defined GitHub Actions steps)

version.description: Optional version of the AI engine action (e.g., 'beta', 'stable'). Has sensible defaults and can typically be omitted.

model.description: Optional specific LLM model to use (e.g., 'claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022', 'gpt-4'). Has sensible defaults and can typically be omitted.

max-turns.description: Maximum number of chat iterations per run. Helps prevent runaway loops and control costs. Has sensible defaults and can typically be omitted.

user-agent.description: Custom user agent string for GitHub MCP server configuration (codex engine only)

env.description: Custom environment variables to pass to the AI engine, including secret overrides (e.g., OPENAI_API_KEY: ${{ secrets.CUSTOM_KEY }})

steps.description: Custom GitHub Actions steps for 'custom' engine. Define your own deterministic workflow steps instead of using AI processing.

error_patterns.description: Custom error patterns for validating agent logs

pattern.description: Ecma script regular expression pattern to match log lines

level_group.description: Capture group index (1-based) that contains the error level. Use 0 to infer from pattern content.

message_group.description: Capture group index (1-based) that contains the error message. Use 0 to use the entire match.

description.description: Human-readable description of what this pattern matches

config.description: Additional TOML configuration text that will be appended to the generated config.toml in the action (codex engine only)
